intro: Hymenospron rubrum, commonly known as the red-spored nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, and it is known for its stinging hairs that can cause skin irritation. Hymenospron rubrum typically grows in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Its life cycle involves both sexual and asexual reproduction, contributing to its adaptability in various environments.
